subject: The Post Most: A mass shooting survivor and her community are still healing a year later
body:
Israel invades West Bank city, killing at least 8 Palestinians 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  
 
 
 
Sign up for this newsletter

(Jamie Kelter Davis for The Post)
In Highland Park, a shooting survivor and her community are still healing 
Sheila Gutman, who a year later has yet to walk again, now grasps how deep the collective trauma is after a mass killing. “We have to do better,” she says.
By Susan Berger

subject: What's happened in the last 3 years?
body:
We're researching the progress (or lack thereof) on racial equity and justice, and we want to hear from our community of DEIJ practitioners.
 
It's been three years since George Floyd was murdered. Three years since the world united in demanding justice. Three years since the outpouring of organizational commitments for racial equity.
 
And what's happened in those three years? 
 
The Winters Group is researching the progress (or lack thereof) on racial equity and justice that we're seeing as a community of DEIJ practitioners and advocates. We're considering questions like: Has your organization realized steps toward racial equity? Have you encountered roadblocks along the way? Some of both? 
 
We're hosting a 
virtual townhall discussion on July 12
 to hear your perspectives on society's progress on equity and justice and to discuss the importance of standing strong in our commitments to DEIJ. Don't miss this opportunity to be in community with your fellow practitioners as we strive for progress.
 
Register here to join us on July 12.
Register Here for This Conversation
 
Date: July 12, 2023, 2:00pm - 4:00pm ET
Location: Virtual
Price: Free with 
contributions 
to our work welcomed
While we are keeping this event free, we ask that you please consider contributing if you have the means. 
Your contribution helps keep our Virtual Learning Labs accessible for all and supports our mission to advance DEIJ thought leadership that helps build equitable and just systems inside the workplace and beyond. 
You can make a contribution here.
 
*Your contribution will NOT register you for any labs, so don’t forget to 
register to secure your spot!
Follow along and join in the conversations online using 
#WintersGroupVLL
!
 
 
 
 
The Winters Group, 8116 South Tryon Street, Ste. B3-260, Charlotte, North Carolina 28273, United States 
Unsubscribe
 
Manage preferences

subject: The power of “in the moment” performance 💡
body:
See the research on why a continuous approach to performance helps organizations work smarter
 
 
FEATURED
 
The science behind continuous performance management
Culture Amp, 4 min read
The traditional approach to performance reviews puts a lot of pressure on teams – both in terms of the overwhelming workload come review time and the emotions associated with delivering or receiving assessments. Dive into the research behind continuous performance management to learn why an “in the moment” approach has the power to revolutionize the performance management process.
Learn more
 
AROUND THE WEB
 
How Rapido Solutions Group used employee feedback to create a culture based on trust →
Culture Amp, 9 min read
As talent and management services provider Rapido underwent massive growth, they turned to Culture Amp to build a stronger company culture. Read the case study to see how they leveraged engagement surveys to build trust, create impactful employee initiative programs, and improve employee-client relations.
 
High-performing teams use this exercise to build accountability →
Quartz, 3 min read
Many teams think they have a clear understanding of who’s doing what, but the reality is that most teams don’t have that level of shared understanding. Read to learn this 6-step strategy to clarify individual roles, create more accountability, and improve collaboration.
 
The Successful Teams Toolkit →
LifeLabs Learning
With the right skills and tools, every team can become more effective and productive. Download this new toolkit from LifeLabs Learning to build strong, effective, and resilient teams at your organization. Available to you at no cost, this resource contains over 15 powerful tools and templates to unlock organizational effectiveness.
Virtual and on-demand events
Employee Engagement 101: How it delivers higher profits, greater productivity & lower turnover
Watch on demand
On demand
Performance Management 101: Reducing the stress of performance reviews
Watch on demand
On demand
Learning & Development 101: How to attract and retain talent
Watch on demand
On demand
Culture First Highlight
 
Connect with other culture leaders in our community
 
If you’re passionate about helping people be better and believe that better understanding culture is how we create a better world of work, then you’re already Culture First. Now, it’s time to link up with people just like you – and discover what you can achieve together.
 
Find your people

The Culture First Podcast distills the wisdom of People & Culture experts into insightful stories for the modern leader.

subject: 2023 Payroll Law Virtual Workshop | Wages, Records, Withholdings …
body:
Expert overview of new regulations   |   
Learn more
Hi Jeffrey,
You’ve been selected to attend a 
LIVE, virtual payroll law workshop
. 
Payroll law has become so complicated, it’s easier than ever to make mistakes. That’s why we developed this 
unique, interactive training
 — to show where you might be vulnerable and how you can fix potential problems before it’s too late.
Don’t be one of the many companies that wind up on the wrong end of lawsuits and audits for payroll violations. In 2019, the U.S. Department of Labor collected a whopping $322 million in back wages alone. 
No industry is safe.
That’s why we recommend 
Payroll Law
 for payroll professionals who want to 
avoid costly mistakes
 and get up to date fast on the most complex and least understood payroll laws. Enroll today and you’ll learn:
•
Critical payroll regulations you can’t afford NOT to know 
•
The top payroll law mistakes that could get you hauled into court
•
How to avoid employee classification errors that will cost dearly
And that’s just for starters. You’ll cover minimum wage laws, overtime violations, rounding errors, garnishments, levies and much more. Sign up today and arm yourself with the knowledge you need to self-audit your processes, clean up your records and 
ensure 100% payroll compliance.

subject: Employers, get ready: Supreme Court raises the bar on religious accommodation duty
body:
Plus: HR leader's comment results in $2.4M payout
Your weekly jolt of HR News & Advice
July 3, 2023
If you’re getting value from HRMorning, would you please let us know? 
Give Testimonial
 
 
FEATURED STORY
Get ready: Supreme Court raises the bar on religious accommodation duty
As we predicted earlier this year, the U.S. Supreme Court sided with an employee who said his employer should've done more to accommodate his religious beliefs. In its unanimous decision, high Court essentially redefines the concept of “undue hardship” in cases involving religious accommodation. Here are the key takeaways -- and what HR can do to adapt to the new ruling.
Continue Reading
 
 
PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT
5 conversations managers need to have with employees – but avoid
Many people put off uncomfortable conversations for as long as six months, a recent study found. But in the workplace, the consequences of not having these awkward chats can affect everything from team dynamics to morale to productivity. Here are five ways HR can help. 
 
POLICY & PROCEDURES
7 essential steps for bulletproof documentation, according to an attorney 
Documentation can be "exhibit A" at trial, said attorney Allison West in a recent SHRM talk – that’s why it’s so important to get right. Here are seven steps for bulletproof documentation to help safeguard your company.
 
CASE STUDY
Education benefit allows employees to earn degree, grow professionally
Partnered with three universities to create customized programs.
EMPLOYMENT LAW
HR leader said what!? Questionable comment at ‘Leadership Town Hall’ results in $2.4M payout
The wrong words can make employees feel excluded or ostracized at work. And as this case shows, careless words from HR can be very expensive.
RECRUITING
Uh-oh: Over half of hiring managers admit to checking candidates’ social media for illegal info
Heads up, HR: Some hiring managers admit they’ve check candidates’ social media to get info that would be illegal to ask in the interview. Here’s what you need to know to protect your company.
VOICES OF HR, A WEEKLY PODCAST FROM HRMORNING
 
Episode 20 is now available
The Biden administration has taken a stance to protect employees, especially when it comes to hot topics like sexual harassment, nondisclosure agreements, pregnancy and women returning to work after the birth or adoption of a child. And there could be severe consequences for employers who don't follow the letter of the law. To get you up to speed on recent, impactful changes to employment law, we talked to employee advocate attorney Joyce Collier, partner at Uebler Law, LLC.
Get the Podcast
 
Sponsored Content
WEBINARS
 
Authenticity at Work with Robin Roberts
When organizations prioritize employees’ psychological safety, awareness and availability, they reap the benefits of having a workforce whose members feel secure bringing an array of opinions to the table. This high-engagement environment naturally cultivates success in recruiting and retention, as well as improved productivity and lowered absenteeism.
July 6
Navigating HR Tech Adoption at Your Company
In this 
free webinar
 on July 19th, you’ll get expert insights on identifying the right tech solution for your company, crafting a compelling case for leadership, and creating a smooth implementation process that garners buy-in from your entire team.
July 19
Financial Wellness Benefits for a Modern and Diverse Workforce
Join us on July 25th to explore how a modern suite of benefits can strengthen your retention strategy, while boosting your DE&I initiatives. This exclusive webinar will equip you with the knowledge and tools necessary to implement effective financial wellness benefits that resonate with your diverse employee base. You’ll also get a look at how easy managing these benefits can be through a demo of Betterment’s financial wellness platform.
July 25
 
 
 
WHITE PAPERS / E-BOOKS
 
Toxic Work Culture Harms Your Employees’ Mental and Physical Health
Five Creative Ways to Cut Benefits Costs
in 2023
TALENT MANAGEMENT
7 talent management strategies for success
To boost your company’s talent management efforts, check out these seven proven strategies for attracting, retaining, and developing top talent, courtesy of our HR expert contributor Jordan Nottrodt.
 
LEADERSHIP & STRATEGY
What’s wrong with employee engagement now — and 5 ways to fix it
An inside look at the biggest threats to employee engagement right now — and expert advice on how to keep each one at bay or resolve it before it causes problems in the workplace.
 
HR TECHNOLOGY
51% of HR pros say increased budget can help provide L&D opportunities
Learning and development (L&D) opportunities are crucial to employee engagement and retention. But they come at a cost – and budgets are lean. These four software pricing models can help HR pros assess how much bang they'll get for their buck. 
 
CASE STUDY
How we got leadership buy-in from older employees
When an employee was first promoted to department manager, we encountered an issue we weren’t expecting.
EMPLOYMENT LAW
FLSA retaliation: What a $39K mistake looks like
A former employee turned to the DOL for help collecting his final paycheck. Tempers flared – and the employer’s hasty reaction did not go over well in court.
HRMorning INSIDER
ON-DEMAND TRAINING
 
Employment Law For Supervisors & Managers: Must-Know Regulations
ADA & FMLA: How Long Is Too Long For Leave?
Surviving As A One-Person HR Department: Avoid Lawsuits & Stress
BLUEPRINTS
 
Wining the War for Talent
A Step-by-Step Framework for Recruiting the Talent You Need
The HRMorning Interviewing Framework
Weed Out Bad Fits and Boost Your Hiring Success
 
LEGAL Q&A and SCENARIOS
 
Question: Our employees can’t work remotely at all. What other ways can we offer flexibility?
 
Was reason for job transfer retaliation or legit?
Affirmative action advocate claims she was subjected to hostile work environment.
 
New employee has a bad work ethic, attitude … but he’s the boss’s nephew
Lack of experience and initiative create problems for co-workers
 
Learn More about HRMorning INSIDER

subject: HR grey areas: can you spot the legal landmines?
body:
Guess the outcome of this HR legal case 
view this email online
Worker's Facebook post suggests suing his employer. Can he be fired?
John Brown got called in to his HR Manager's office and asked about his recent posts on Facebook. A co-worker was fired and John suggested she sue their employer. The company said John's comments were damaging to the company, violated their social media policy, and he was being terminated - immediately.
John filed an unfair labor practice charge with the National Labor Relations Board. He said his speech rights were violated.
Can you guess the outcome of this real case?
HRMorning's "You Be the Judge" quizzes let you guess the outcome of cases just like this one.
They're relevant legal cases, dramatized and interesting to read. You'll get a summary of the situation, then you use your judgment to guess the verdict before we show you the judge's decision. You'll also get a brief analysis of what the decision could mean for your company.
As an HRMorning INSIDER member, you'll get 
50 of these thought-provoking quizzes
, plus a growing library of 400+ exclusive resources that you can 
try free for 21 days
.
These fun, challenging quizzes will help you
 gain clarity on how the courts interpret employment law grey areas
. As you sharpen your judgment on these practice cases, you'll increase your confidence to handle similar situations when faced with them.
CLICK TO SEE 16 QUIZ TOPICS
 
Here's how the courts ruled on John's 'free speech on Facebook' case:
The NLRB overturned the termination and ruled John's discharge violated the National Labor Relations Act - which protects employees' ability to talk about work conditions in a concerted (i.e., group) manner because:
the Facebook exchange was concerted and conducted for mutual aid or protection of workers, and
the company's social media policy was illegal.
The NLRB said the company's social media policy was too broad. It said the language prohibiting employees from making social media posts that would damage the company's image was too restrictive and could "chill" employees' protected ability to talk about work conditions.
Analysis: NLRB wants you to let employees talk
The NLRB can overturn terminations by both union and non-union employers, making rulings like this real game-changers for companies' social media policies.
While no employer wants to see their workers trash talking the company or talking about filing a lawsuit, those types of conversations are often protected by law - at least i the eyes of the current NLRB. So it's wise to consider revising policies that restrict those kinds of discussions.
Cite
: NLRB opinion; Butler Medical Transport LLC and Michael rice and William Lewis Norvell,Nos. 05-CA-094981, 097810, 097854, 7/27/17. 
Fictionalized for dramatic effect.
CLICK TO SEE 16 QUIZ TOPICS
 
To your success,
Sharon
and the HRMorning Team
Sharon
 from
 
HRMorning
Privacy Policy
 | 
Unsubscribe
HRMorning
 
Success
Fuel
 
660 American Avenue, Suite 203  King of Prussia, PA 19406

subject: OVERGROUND_Only a few hours left until this afternoon's photography mini-course.  Will you be one of us?
body:
OVERGROUND: FOTOGRAFA LE EMOZIONI E LE GEOGRAFIE UMANE
 
View this email in your browser
 
Upcoming Event 
OVERGROUND: FOTOGRAFA LE EMOZIONI E LE GEOGRAFIE UMANE
   
 
 
OVERGROUND: FOTOGRAFA LE EMOZIONI E LE GEOGRAFIE UMANE
The event is today, July 3rd from 6 pm - 8 pm with 
Marco Bertagni 
 
We are thrilled to invite you to OVERGROUND.
During the
 fantastic event, our member Marco Bertagni 
will give us
 a mini-photography course 
on the
 4,600 photos 
of his many
 precious journeys
 as proudly captured in the digital
 archive 
of
 Società Geografica Italiana  (see website 
here
)
Emotions are an extraordinary bridge between the people who inhabit our planet. 
Marco
 will help us learn how to photograph them through
